summary: This function creates a new array of short values.
formals: is the number of elements in the new array.
returns: The new array object is returned.
example-1: module Main in execution;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    # Create a new array. %0A    val array = F::newShortArray(5);%0A%0A    # Compute the length of the array. %0A    val length = F::len(array);%0A%0A    # Print the length of the array. %0A    F::println(%22Length = %22 .. length);%0A%0A    # Set the values of the elements in the array.%0A    F::set(array, 0, 10S);%0A    F::set(array, 1, 20S);%0A    F::set(array, 2, 30S);%0A    F::set(array, 3, 40S);%0A    F::set(array, 4, 50S);%0A%0A    # Retrieve the values of the elements in the array.%0A    val value0 = F::get(array, 0);%0A    val value1 = F::get(array, 1);%0A    val value2 = F::get(array, 2);%0A    val value3 = F::get(array, 3);%0A    val value4 = F::get(array, 4);%0A%0A    # Print the aforesaid values. %0A    F::println(%22Value[0] = %22 .. value0);%0A    F::println(%22Value[1] = %22 .. value1);%0A    F::println(%22Value[2] = %22 .. value2);%0A    F::println(%22Value[3] = %22 .. value3);%0A    F::println(%22Value[4] = %22 .. value4);%0A}
